name: AI4ALL
date: All dates range between late June - early August
location: Arizona State University, Arizona; Boston University, Massachusetts; Carnegie Mellon University, Pennsylvania; Columbia University, New York; Georgia Tech University, Georgia; Princeton University, New Jersey; Seattle University, Washington; Simon Fraser University, British Columbia, Canada; Stanford University, California; University of California Berkeley, California; University of California San Francisco, California; University of Maryland, Maryland; University of Michigan, Michigan; University of Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania; University of Texas at El Paso, Texas; University of Washington, Washington
application_timeframe: Dependent on the specific university program
description: Summer program focused on supporting underrepresented communities in AI. The program includes course work and a final project.

name: Cornell Engineering Experience
description: A residential program that includes lab exercises, team projects, guest speakers, and field trips. It also features a design challenge and emphasizes career exploration of the field of engineering.

name: National High School Game Academy
description: Summer program focused on video game development; blending art, music, design and programming. The first three weeks include instruction, while the second half provides students with the opportunity to make their own original video game.

name: Summer Academy for Math and Science (SAMississippi)
description: A summer program providing opportunities to students from underrepresented communities. It includes math and science curriculum, seminars and professional/academic development workshops.

name: Columbia Summer Immersion
date: Multiple sessions running from late June - mid-August
location: Columbia University, New York, New York
application_timeframe: Rolling admissions that close in June-July depending on the session
description: A summer program that offers courses on technology and computer programming as well as general STEM.

name: Computer Science Summer Institute (CSSI)
date: Most dates range between early July - mid-August
location: Alabama A&M University, Alabama; North Carolina Central University, North Carolina; California State University Monterey Bay, California; California State University Chico, California; California State University Dominguez Hills, California; Make School, California; Loyola Marymount University, California; Northeastern Illinois University, Illinois; Medgar Evers College City University of New York, New York; University of Bridgeport, Connecticut; Queens College City University of New York, New York; San Jose State University, California; University of North Florida, Florida; Atlanta, Georgia; Cambridge, Massachusetts; Chicago, Illinois; Detroit, Michigan; Washington D.C.; Los Angeles, California; Mountain View, California; New York City, New York; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Seattle, Washington; Waterloo, ON, Canada
description: A three-week introductory computer science program for graduating high school seniors, with an emphasis on supporting underrepresented communities. It aims to help develop technical skills, networking as well as exposure to Google's environment.

name: Harvard Pre-College Program
date: Three sessions running late June - early August
length: Multiple two-week sessions and a seven-week session
description: A rigorous summer program with courses offered focusing on areas of STEM. Depending on the length of the program, students can receive college credit.

name: STEM for Rising 9th and 10th Graders
description: A summer program for rising 9th and 10th graders including academic content, laboratory and/or field exercises. Participants also work on a research or design challenge throughout the program.

name: BU Research in Science & Engineering Program (Rhode IslandSE)
description: A summer program for rising seniors offering two intensive research opportunities under the guidance of Boston University faculty, postdoctoral fellows and graduate students.

name: Secondary Student Training Program
location: University of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa
description: A summer research program where rising juniors and seniors can complete a university-level research project with a research group and experience life as a university student.

name: International Summer School for Young Physicists (ISSYP)
description: A physics-focused summer program for rising seniors and rising college freshman. It features presentations, lab tours, and other opportunities to study modern physics.
